intro: Odontarrhena polyclada, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellowish-green flower heads. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and savanna ecosystems. Odontarrhena polyclada is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
